page.title: 09PLACES OF WORSHIP N.LEEDS
page.content: CHURCH OF THE IMMACULATE HEART OF MARY In 1945 a new Catholic parish was established in Moortown with the purchase of The Grange(a large house with grounds, at Moortown Corner).Mass was said in the house and the Corner House was used for special social functions. In 1949 Fr. McShane bought Broomhill Estate on Harrogate Road and the Sisters of the Cross and Passion took over The Grange.The parishioners built a hall whilst the church was being erected next door.Both were opened by Bishop Heenan. The church was built in Romanesque style with a tower and a cupola. In 1976 a new middle school was built in the same grounds as the church.St Andrews RC Middle School caters for the Catholic children in the N. Leeds area.
